title: Ethereum 'Pectra' Upgrade Goes Live – Staking Withdrawals Finally Here
shortdescription: Long-awaited upgrade unlocks $35B in staked ETH – price surges 12% overnight.
author: Emma Chen

content.content: The Biggest Ethereum Upgrade Since the Merge

The Ethereum Pectra upgrade has successfully activated on the mainnet, marking the most significant protocol improvement since the 2022 Merge. The upgrade introduces several critical features, including EIP-7251 for validator withdrawals and EIP-6110 for deposit contract consolidation. These changes address long-standing pain points in Ethereum's proof-of-stake system and are expected to unlock over $35 billion in staked ETH that has been locked since the Merge. The upgrade also includes improvements to the execution layer, such as EIP-7702 for account abstraction, which will enable more user-friendly wallet experiences and pave the way for social recovery mechanisms.

The ability to withdraw staked ETH represents the culmination of three years of anticipation for validators who have been locked in since the Merge. Over 30 million ETH worth more than $35 billion can now be withdrawn, providing much-needed liquidity to the DeFi ecosystem. While some validators may choose to keep their ETH staked for the 4-5% annual yield, others — particularly institutional investors — will likely take profits and rotate into other opportunities. The market has already priced in a significant portion of this unlock, with ETH trading up 12% in the 24 hours following the upgrade announcement. Ethereum's price stability during the upgrade process demonstrates the network's maturity and the community's confidence in its development team.
